channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report E-2025020173
item.description:
Report E-2025020173

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T03:17:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-12
  • City: HUNTSVILLE
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 12, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN2735 was damaged and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Marion Environmental Inc. (MEI) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all product into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The contents from the damaged drum were transferred into one (1) new 275-gallon tote for further shipment.
